findings.title: EmptyByteArrayCopy
findings.description: Copying an empty byte array (or string) from memory or calldata to storage can result in data corruption if the target array's length is increased subsequently without storing new data.

findings.title: DynamicArrayCleanup
findings.description: When assigning a dynamically-sized array with types of size at most 16 bytes in storage causing the assigned array to shrink, some parts of deleted slots were not zeroed out.

findings.title: Incorrect ERC20 implementation
findings.description: The contract does not conform to the ERC20 standard.

findings.title: Outdated compiler version
findings.description: Using outdated solidity compiler versions can lead to known bugs and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: No or floating compiler version set
findings.description: Using an outdated or unspecified solidity compiler version can lead to bugs and vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Use of right-to-left-override control character
findings.description: The code uses a right-to-left-override control character which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security issues.

findings.title: Shadowing of built-in symbol
findings.description: The code shadows a built-in symbol which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Incorrect constructor name
findings.description: The contract's constructor has an incorrect name, which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: State variable shadows another state variable
findings.description: A state variable has the same name as another state variable, potentially leading to confusion and unintended behavior.

findings.title: Local variable shadows a state variable
findings.description: A local variable has the same name as a state variable, which can lead to confusion and unintended behavior.

findings.title: Function parameter shadows a state variable
findings.description: A function parameter has the same name as a state variable, which can lead to confusion and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Named return value shadows a state variable
findings.description: A named return value has the same name as a state variable, which can lead to confusion and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Unary operation without effect
findings.description: Unary operation has no effect on the variable or state in Solidity code analysis.

findings.title: Unary operation directly after assignment
findings.description: The unary operation is performed immediately after a variable assignment, which can lead to unexpected behavior or incorrect results.

findings.title: Unused state variable
findings.description: The contract has a state variable that is declared but never used.

findings.title: Unused local variable
findings.description: Local variables that are declared but never used can make the code harder to read and understand.

findings.title: Function visibility is not set
findings.description: The function's visibility (public, private, internal, or external) has not been explicitly defined.

findings.title: State variable visibility is not set
findings.description: The visibility of a state variable is not explicitly set, which can lead to unintended access or modification.

findings.title: Use of deprecated functions: call code(), sha3(), …
findings.description: Using deprecated functions can lead to security vulnerabilities and compatibility issues.

findings.title: Use of deprecated global variables (msg.gas, …)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated global variables such as msg.gas, which can lead to compatibility issues and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Use of deprecated keywords (throw, var)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated Solidity keywords 'throw' and 'var', which can lead to compatibility issues and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Incorrect function state mutability
findings.description: Function's state mutability does not match its intended behavior.

findings.title: Events Access:
findings.description: The setOwner function in TapGovernance contract should emit an event when the owner is updated.

findings.title: Timestamp:
findings.description: The delegateBySig function uses timestamp for comparisons which can be dangerous

findings.title: Incorrect equality:
findings.description: TapGovernance._writeCheckpoint uses a dangerous strict equality
